name: gusplease
text: A comment left by gusplease was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lamelliform, whoper, TSRTS13, Kennisiou, -0_0-, nutmeg, moteld, greyfield)

name: mjfitzge
text: i like mcsweeney's, but not as much as i like achewood... this strip makes me feel weird...

name: boredom_man
text: Same here, but nothing to feel weird about. Satire doesn't seek our loyalty.

name: thesyndicate88
text: Achewood makes me feel weird in that "I just saw nude breasts for the first time" kind of way. Strange and foreign, but ultimately really awesome.

name: molesticide
text:
oh man. i remember that.

that was awesome.

name: tangram
text: Indeed.

name: onepapertiger
text: chubbied

name: vermy
text: Who can forget?

name: pigs
text:
What's that actually like?
*sobs*
Oh God, I'm so lonely.

name: tekende
text:
Well

It's kind of like
basketball

I am there

And the breasts are there

And I touch them

And I am the winner

name: slab64
text:
Why is this not chubbied to hell?

I lolled

name: likeiwassaying
text: whoever lamed this is the saddest person who has ever lived, and they are aggressively dedicated to being sad.

name: foetus_punch
text: And then the saddest little man lames the man who tries to highlight his sadness. Truly, he is the saddest little man.

name: gmm
text:
Did you write "Satire doesn't seek our loyalty" yourself? If so - a teenage boy in another country has quoted you out loud to friends. Because it's brilliant and true.

I am also a fan of McSweeney's

name: boredom_man
text: I feel just like a Bertolucci film!

name: vermy
text: And that's what Onstad wants you to feel.

name: catachresis
text: It transforms from a humourous mock into a urine-squirting indictment. So good.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I showed this to a friend who's a big Chris Ware head, and he got all hurt and mopey about it. It was weird.

name: nathanielperson
text: The friend is upset by the opinions of the dead cartoon cats.

name: boredom_man
text: By all appearances, Chris Ware is not.

name: petro
text: The fact that there is a duty free store in the departure terminal of this life makes me not fear death.

name: subtilior
text: Except that it means that there is tax in heaven.

name: carrot
text: A comment left by carrot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, lamboyster, Unfun, Jesler729, TonyHighwind, _cheesekayke, aquamuffin, michellemarie, mystkmanat, turnabout, STUART)

name: bixschmix
text: It's not casual; it's the first thing he does! She's obviously been on his mind.

name: lux
text: She's so glad he's dead again.

name: songbirdspectre
text: They have duty-free on the way to heaven. Awesome. I need that. Gotta pick up my compulsory 6 bottles of Cable Bay.

name: cassandrakazenzakis
text: i like how there's a duty free on the way to heaven.

name: goosey
text:
Like everyone else, I love that there's a Duty Free in Heaven.

Is this the first time we learn Molly's surname? That's always vaguely bugged me, since it reminds me of Moll Flanders, who is pretty much the opposite of how anyone halfway logical sees Molly.

name: snowman
text: Molly's last name is Sanders.  The McSweeney in the title refers to McSweeney's, the elitist lit mag they're talking about in the strip.

name: goosey
text: I was talking about the first panel, not the title.

name: snowman
text: Ohhhh...man, in re-reading your comment, I don't even know how I made that mistake.  Sorry.

name: deusoma
text: Beef hasn't used exclamation points in a while now.

name: peterjoel
text: Everyone uses exclamation points in heaven. It's gets annoying pretty fast.

name: phy
text: Heaven and Archie Comics.

name: dasilodavi
text: A comment left by dasilodavi was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by xiaomimi, rachel, choosebro, nutmeg, Wulvaine, erinye, Darthemed)

name: spinynorman
text: Man, don't you hate it when you're at a lame party and a friend of yours clicks with a stranger like this? It's like watching him riding a rollercoaster and eating an ice cream sundae while you're sitting in the penalty box at a hockey game while inner city fans spit at the back of your head.

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lamboyster, GeyserShitdick, Latterman, Doc_Rostov, stormagnet)

name: ovenface
text: your opinions are particularly amusing given the self-indulgent wind-baggy way you just stated them.

name: apocowarg
text: Well played, sir.

name: spinynorman
text: I was describing an exact experience, word for word.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You were exactly sitting in the box getting spat on while your friend was smoothing, riding a roller coaster and getting his Cone on? And you said this was a lame party?

Damn, I at least hope you were in for a high sticking double minor on your friend.

name: spinynorman
text: Oh wait you were talking to some other dude, sorry :(

name: goddessdictator
text: ah but i am always particularly amused by your comments. and i am in fact talking to you. not rowboat.

name: rowboat
text: She finds me particularly amusing! That's sweet, but I think you're a bit young for me.

name: spinynorman
text:
I can't help but read that in the voice of Rudolph the Red-nosed Reindeer saying, "She thinks I'm cute! "

Ah, irony.

name: rowboat
text: That was exactly the voice in which I wrote it. Good eye.

name: boredom_man
text: He feels just like a Peter Greenaway film!

name: c_dizzle
text: I am buying a bottle of bourbon before reaching the pearly gates. ...or to share with Lucifer. ...I have no regrets.

name: stuart
text: What's interesting here is that with any other comic this would just be the author clumsily writing a pretentious review of something he dislikes into the dialogue of his characters. In Achewood, it's two characters discovering just how perfect they are for each other.

name: gethen
text: Why don't beef and molly talk like this anymore?

name: fineoakstructure
text: Because they already know all this mundane crap about each other.  If they were still having introductory conversations about hipster lit and were due to get married soon, I'd be worried.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: TO-DAY IS THE DAY!

name: nucleargeranium
text: His robe in heaven makes him look chubby.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: Man Molly would be an awesome girlfriend.

name: atticusonline
text: This is love!

name: i_love_kate
text: Is this love?

name: atticusonline
text: Love, this is.

name: theguitarhero
text: Baby don't hurt me.

name: corm
text: do you think it is rad to play among the ruins of a once-great literary culture that is no longer relevant and struggles for justification mcsweeney's

name: saulbellow
text:
do you think it is wrong

or do you agree that it is okay

name: woodenteeth
text:
I'm going to be all kinds of obvious, but has anyone ever mentioned the reason the boys get out of Heaven/Hell so often is that they all have 9 lives, being cats.

Todd is an exception because Squirrels are entirely interchangeable. The same 10,000 squirrels have been reincarnating since the begginning of time and getting absolutely nowhere .

name: falseprophet
text: Squirrels are no longer relevant and struggle for justification.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Hahahaha, this phrase could be one of those things that gets funnier as it's used repeatedly.

name: troy_convers
text: Man I hope they're not eating chicken with a ding-a-ling again...

name: wallabeechamp
text: I think the dead cats are wrong. Reading McSweeney's would punish right now.
